Hi miss, I am wondering do you guys get a way to integration test sharding-proxy, I don't know how to debug this kind of bugs locally.

Actually, I am a little confuse whether this is a bug or not.

But I tried mycat, then get only one row data in this test case.
And, suppose we can select one more time from the result(two row data),  we will just get one row data.

So I report it as a bug finally.
Hi @dawuti, Can you provide your sharding configuration and example SQLs?
Create issue in englist pleaseÔºåthis class was generated by antlr, use command mvn clean install

thank you for your answer

‚Äú1 == shardingLogicTableNames.size() return the first table name": the outer query just has one table, the column just belong to this table,  ignore subquery condition use its table, it cause parsing wrong table name
please show your sharding rule 
thanks

> please show your sharding rule
sharding rule is
```
customer_account_change_record:
    tableStrategy:
            standard:
              shardingColumn: created
              precise-algorithm-class-name: xxx.TimeSharding$PreciseTimeSharding
              range-algorithm-class-name: xxx.TimeSharding$RangeTimeSharding
```
OK.I do not know whether  Is it necessary to do check for update shard key, or maybe have some more better ways to do that.
customer is binding table with customer_account_change_recordÔºüor customer  is not sharding table?

> customer is binding table with customer_account_change_recordÔºü

no. customer is single table, and customer_account_change_record is multi talbe

‚Äî
You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.

@traceless Hi,
There two scenarios that we need to jump to next millSecond.
First, sequences in one millSecond are used up, i.e, `0L == (sequence = (sequence + 1) & SEQUENCE_MASK)`. In this condition, all distributed IDs will not lean toward odd or even. Therefore, it is not necessary to `vibrateSequenceOffset()`.
Second, one distributed ID every millSecond. In this condititon, we need to `vibrateSequenceOffset()` to avoid leaning toward even numbers.
What's your opinion?

@tristaZero Hi
I thought the 'SequenceOffset' was designed for the sequence offset Ôºåbut i can find anyway to set the variable 'SequenceOffset' , so i just run the vibrateSequenceOffset method and found the result was alternate 1,0,1,0 . i don't konw why don't you set it to 0 directly?

@tristaZero 
so , it no problem in you code.   Because I misunderstood it ('vibrateSequenceOffset')
@tuohai666. Beacuse, the issue has been resolved, after modified config-sharding.yaml.

The sql has two  sharding tables ts_order and ts_order_addressÔºå but only has one sharding columnÔºåts_order_address table has no sharding conditionÔºåit cause route all datasource and all tables.
configure ts_order and ts_order_address to binding table,like this
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39583929/56557666-888b2700-65ce-11e9-9279-9ee1ea1face3.png)

@traceless
 Thanks for your reply, so can we close this issue?

@tristaZero 
OK Ôºåwithout doubt
The SQL has subquery in where condition, it does not always route in one sharding datasource, the SQL is not supported now
this problem is still exist on dev and v4.0.0.RC1.  I will test 4.0.0.RC1.
use default-data-source-name="rw0"

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39583929/56570404-78cf0b00-65ed-11e9-85de-54a14577fc98.png)

Thanks so much for your reply. This config resolve my problem !
J just found the config in [document](https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/current/cn/manual/sharding-jdbc/configuration/config-yaml)

```yaml
  bindingTables: # ÁªëÂÆöË°®,‰πüÂ∞±ÊòØÂÆûÈôÖ‰∏äÂì™‰∫õÈÖçÁΩÆÁöÑsharidngË°®ËßÑÂàôÈúÄË¶ÅÂÆûÈôÖÁîüÊïàÁöÑÂàóË°®,ÈÖçÁΩÆ‰∏∫yamlÂàóË°®,Âπ∂‰∏îÂÖÅËÆ∏Âçï‰∏™Êù°ÁõÆ‰∏≠‰ª•ÈÄóÂè∑ÂàáÂâ≤,ÊâÄÈÖçÁΩÆË°®ÂøÖÈ°ªÂ∑≤ÁªèÈÖçÁΩÆ‰∏∫ÈÄªËæëË°®
    - sharding_t1
    - sharding_t2,sharding_t3
```


But after read this document,  I still don't know which scene to useÔºå 
what are the side effects of this configuration that need attention?

binding table means  two table has same sharding strategy, two join tables can be binding table. 
if logic table ts_order has one row which   id  is 1 in the table ts_order_0001 , logic table  ts_order_address 
also has one row which order_id is 1 in the ts_order_address_0001 ,  binding table is correct in his situationÔºå
logic table  ts_order_address 
has more than one row which order_id is 1 in the ts_order_address_0001  and ts_order_address_0002,
binding table is not correct  in his situation. the route all sharding data source is correct

I reviewed the code of SelectItemFiller.java (tags  4.0.0.RC1), it is still not merge the #2306 bug fixs(bc9a5010c12897fd60aaa6f3e8a389e7f7cdd4b4).
And I still have the problem.
### SQL: select count( 1 ) from alarm where 1=1
### Cause: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Can't find index: AggregationSelectItem(type=COUNT, innerExpression=( 1 ), alias=Optional.absent(), derivedAggregationSelectItems=[], index=-1), please add alias for aggregate selections

My local maven dependency is 
<dependency>
      <groupId>org.apache.shardingsphere</groupId>
      <artifactId>sharding-jdbc-core</artifactId>
      <version>4.0.0-RC1</version>
    </dependency>
I am so grateful for your help.
No response any more, if not want discuss further, I just close this issue.
This problem is OK in version 3.0.1

template FYI:

## Bug Report

**For English only**, other languages will not accept.

Before report a bug, make sure you have:

- Searched open and closed [GitHub issues](https://github.com/sharding-sphere/sharding-sphere/issues).
- Read documentation: [ShardingSphere Doc](http://shardingsphere.io/document/current/en/overview/).

Please pay attention on issues you submitted, because we maybe need more details. 
If no response **more than 7 days** and we cannot reproduce it on current information, we will **close it**.

Please answer these questions before submitting your issue. Thanks!

### Which version of ShardingSphere did you use?

### Which project did you use? Sharding-JDBC or Sharding-Proxy?

### Expected behavior

### Actual behavior

### Reason analyze (If you can)

### Steps to reproduce the behavior, such as: SQL to execute, sharding rule configuration, when exception occur etc.

### Example codes for reproduce this issue (such as a github link).

@xfyang1989  it also has this problem, i will fix it

I did the following test, but no exception happened.
**ShardingRule Configuration**
```
shardingRule:
  tables:
    t_order:
      actualDataNodes: ds_${0..1}.t_order_${0..1}
      tableStrategy:
        inline:
          shardingColumn: order_id
          algorithmExpression: t_order_${order_id % 2}
      keyGenerator:
        type: SNOWFLAKE
        column: order_id
```
**Table structure**
```
CREATE TABLE `t_order_1` (
  `order_id` bigint(20) NOT NULL,
  `user_id` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `status` varchar(45) DEFAULT NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY (`order_id`)
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8
```

**SQL**
```
insert into t_order values(1,null), (2,2);
```
Do you think this example fits your scenario?

By the way, can you set the props `sql.show=true`? So that we can view log to check the rewritten SQLs are correct or not.
@zhangfenghuang
